definition: bring it on!/give me all you got!
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.chinese: 那么让他们放马过来吧。

sentences.english: Just let them try to stop us.
Come on back, I'm right here.
No, indeed I will not tell, come what.
sentences.chinese: 所以我说，尽管放马过来，我会坚持我的希望。

sentences.english: Come forth, you shall find honor in death.
sentences.chinese: 放马过来，你会死的很光荣。

definition: counter soldiers with arms, water with an earth weir (idiom); different situations call for different action/to adopt measures appropriate to the actual situation
pinyin: bing1 lai2 jiang4 dang3 , shui3 lai2 tu3 yan3

definition: hands tied and waiting to be captured
(fig.) to fight a one-sided battle/to have an unfair advantage in a contest
to throw caution to the wind/to press one's luck/to go for broke
